revised_title: Observations of a Luminous Sea Spot and Analysis of its Contents
tldr: Captain F. Eardley Wilmot observed a large and luminous spot in the sea during his voyage home from the Cape of Good Hope. He collected a sample of the water, which was analyzed by Dr. Faraday. The water contained a high amount of sulphuretted hydrogen and a solid deposit consisting of half sulfur and half organic matter. This suggests that the water was rich in animals or animalcules, and the luminosity could be attributed to bioluminescence.
